fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21970].
  {panel}

Having lots of versions on the Manage version page makes the Scheduling dropdown long. 

We use greenhopper and has a released version named 'no sprint' with no release date for collecting duplicates and other triage activities (making it the top released version in other lists). 

To add a new release you have to open the scheduling dropdown. The scheduling dropdown has the last item as its default, which our 'no sprint' version occupies. 
So we need to scroll down to the (almost) bottom to get to the right version.  
This takes time because the sort order on the scheduling dropdown is oldest at top and newest version is at the bottom.

Reversing the order would make the interaction much faster since the right version would be the first item (or in our case, the second) and no scrolling would be required.

ps.
don't forget to change the default value to the top item
.ds
fields.summary: order of schdule's dropdown items should be the same as in the table on the Manage versions page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21965].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

There is an add-on from Atlassian Labs that provides a rich text dashboard gadget for JIRA Cloud. You can find it by searching for "rich text gadget" in the Find New Add-ons page on your JIRA Cloud instance or [getting it from the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214632/rich-text-gadget-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview].

This add-on is not officially supported by Atlassian.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
 Dave Meyer
 [dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
{panel}
The text gadget can make JIRA vulnerable to XSS attacks because it allows arbitrary html, which is why it is disabled by default.

A wiki rendering replacement could cater to the needs of an arbitrary html gadget without the danger. Custom html could still be added to the wiki gadget where required through the creation of macro plugins for JIRA's wiki renderer.
fields.summary: Replace unsafe text gadget and add to JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21962].
  {panel}

We upgraded to the latest version of JIRA and while the Avatar function is nice it has brought up a concern.

See details of concern in your support system under this issue (https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-62383)

In particular I have the problem that I have a number of people that can administer projects and I have had the problem that some employee uploaded inappropriate pictures as an avatar.

While this seems like a minor inconvenience, it opens up our company to complaints from employees.

We think you need to add the ability to TURN OFF the avatar function in order to reduce this exposure.
fields.summary: Provide the Ability to Turn Off Avatar's
Enable auto-response from email-based issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21958].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please consider using the [SSL for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.jirasslplugin/server/overview] add-on from the Atlassian Marketplace.

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

Adding a cert to the keystore is a somewhat painful process. A browser does this automatically. There's a blog from [sun|http://blogs.sun.com/andreas/entry/no_more_unable_to_find] with a utility that does this programatically. It'd be nice to add an SSL cert to the keystore programatically through JIRA, or better yet a cross-product library.
fields.summary: Add automatic detection of SSL subscriptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21951].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 6 Aug 2010|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA} 
Update - [feedback.onjira.com|http://feedback.onjira.com] has been upgraded again, please re-confirm your issue and let us know of the result.

Hi all,

The upgrade of feedback.onjira.com was incomplete and we are investigating the root cause of this.
We know this because some issues raised such as this one can not be reproduced on our internal test instance.
We do understand you other UI points and will take them into consideration.

Once we upgrade feedback.onjira.com to a satisfactory state we will update this Atlassian status box.
We will also update this issue's status.

We apologise for the inconvenience and we thank you for raising these issues.

Cheers,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

Hallo

Thanks for providing me an account for http://feedback.onjira.com/

I've had a look at the main thing that I find disturbing: the view issue screen.

Compared to 4.1.2 it does look better. For someone who migrates from 4.0.2 the changes still don't feel natural.


The idea to keep action buttons and workflow actions on the screen while scrolling is nice! 
that scrolling mechanism has some drawbacks. in some cases the scrollbar appears that sort of kills the mouse-wheel
(see screenshot). to reproduce: scroll down on issue http://feedback.onjira.com/browse/BOX-1
and click on a lower sub-task menu (number 4 for ex). The view jumps and the additional scrollbar does not go away.


I dont like the buttons on top for actions and workflow. There is one rule I would recommend to follow: *make same things look the same!*
If some workflow actions are buttons and some are memnu-points, how do they differ? well they dont but one could think so.


There is also some white space below the work logs. I understand it is difficult to fill it. So I got a suggestion.


Move the work log inside the issue area (marked in green on the screenshot).
Then the width could be used in full for starting with the description. 
Also it might be an idea to make that area flippable, so it could be vertical or horizontal.

The vertical way would be more for people like me
The horizontal would be more for modern fashioned folks.


There are other things as well:
* you cheat the fix versions, affects versions and components information (marked in magenta) by cutting it
* marked in blue is more what i would like to see together (type, priority, assignee, status, as most important ones)
* comments are hovered on mouseover but one cannot click on them. coloring comments odd / even with a background would make a calmer layout and would avaoid additional lines to distinguish comments
* the breadcrumb navigation on top lacks the issue / sub-issue structure.
fields.summary: Feedback on Jira 4.2 EAP - View Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21937].
  {panel}

It would be really good if the parent issue/task could filter sub-issues/tasks in some useful way. At present there are All/Open tabs but when there are lots of sub-issues one looks for a way to sort them.
I would like to see a version of the configurable and sortable columns that are available in the issue navigator. Especially useful would be:

    * JIRA ID,
    * Affects versions
    * Due date
    * Component
fields.summary: Enhancement Request: when viewing sub-tasks from the parent, allow some sortable columns
Allow nested JQL function calls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21934].
  {panel}

In version 4.0.1 of Jira (and probably in later versions) the complete list of Screens using a Field are shown in the Field Configuration. Since the Field configuration and Screens are related to a project, the Field Configuration should only show the screens that are related to that particular Configuration.

To clarify this a little more:
The field Affected Version/s is on almost every create issue Screen. We have several projects that have different Screen Schemes en Screens attached. The projects also have different Field Configurations related to them. If I choose the Field Configuration of one of the projects, all screens are shown that Affected Version/s is on. I'd like to see only the Screens related to the project here. It looks to me that the query used for creating the View Configuration Page should be altered for this. Please consider implementing this change.

Kind regards,

Johan-Kees Vliek
PinkRoccade Healthcare
fields.summary: Only show Screens that are related to selected Field Configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21933].
  {panel}

Dear Atlassian!

I don't know whether a ticket like this already exits or was solved, but I couln't find any.

We would like to have displayed for any user after he logged in the time when he logged in before.
This helps to find out whether someone else got hold of username&password and uses the account and thus is important to us.
It could be the same as the massege you get when you e.g. log in into your bank account.
just like: "You're last login before: May12th, 2010, 11:22"

Thank you very much,
Tido Lorenz
S&N AG
fields.summary: Display Last-Login-Date for the User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21928].
  {panel}

i need a filter which generates the issues resolved in two business days back from the current date. how to take the business days into consider leaving out the weekends.

User case example:
Search issues by using JQL query:
"project = TEST AND updated <= -2d" 

which will provide all tickets updated before 2 days and in last 2 days their is no activity. In this use case, I need to exclude the weekends. (non-working dates).
fields.summary: Consider Business Days in filter
As a user, I should be able to see Voters and Watchers on Mouse Over
As a user, I would like to have PDF views and reports as a standard feature
Unification of behavior for the assign operation and custom field of type "user picker"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21903].

Hello,

I have added a custom field to my release notes template, but I would like to have it's content rendered. Is there any way how to use RendererManager ?

Best regards,
Eva
fields.summary: rendering content in Release notes template
Add Exchange Web Services (EWS) as a mail listener to JIRA
Display issues by type on Project Issues tab
I would like to be able to define Watchers while I am creating new Issue
As a commenter, I want to suppress email notifications of my comment to Watchers.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21889].
  {panel}

The new JIRA feature allowing customization of JIRA email notification subject lines is great.

The problem is nearly 100% of the time, we'd like to make a single customization of the subject line applicable to all notification types.  But to do so, we have to duplicate that custom .vm file about 15 times, once for each notification type.

It would be much more admin friendly to implement a single default .vm -- e.g. subject/default.vm -- that applies to all notification types unless a more specific .vm file is present overriding the default for a specific notification type.

i.e. only need 1 file -- subject/default.vm -- if that works for all your email notifications.  But if want issuecreated.vm to be a special case, you can provide that file also to override the default.
fields.summary: customizing email subject lines requires major duplication of effort -- implement a default .vm file with per-notification type files as optional overrides

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21888].

{panel:title=21 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are not currently any plans to implement this suggestion.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Otto Ruettinger
Principal Product Manager, JIRA
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original Description*
Why is it REQUIRED that I enter an email prefix when configuring an SMTP Server for JIRA? Rather presumptuous that all users want this.

For filtering in the email client, all my emails from JIRA are differentiated by the From address. I don't need (JIRA) or anything else prepended to every subject line. And furthermore, now that I can config custom subject lines per email notification type, I could always prepend whatever I want to each subject line in those Velocity templates including "(JIRA)" if I so wanted.

Please remove this requirement from defining the SMTP server.

The problem needs fixing in:
 - MailServerActionSupport.java doValidation() – remove check for isBlank(prefix)
 - remove "<ui:param name="'mandatory'">true</ui:param>" from updatesmtpmailserver.jsp
fields.summary: remove requirement for entering an email prefix in the SMTP Server config
Allow JIRA to accept entering work with a comma in time tracking
Expose XsrfInvocationChecker for use by plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21882].
  {panel}

Please add the ability to MERGE or APPEND when doing a Bulk Issue change and editing labels.

For example,

If I am working with a list of JIRA tickets that have 3 different labels and I want to add the label: peter_filias, it will remove all 3 labels and add peter_filias. I'd like to have the ability to do a BULK ADD of a label, for example.

I'd also like to have the ability to MOVE where the label field shows up when I am working with filters. I currently have to scroll halfway down my page to find the label field. It would be very helpful if you could customize the filter creation/editing order of elements in the left column.
fields.summary: More functionality with labels/tags.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21878].
  {panel}

Steps to repro:

1. Log into jira on screen 1
2. open jira on screen 2
3. open the view issue page for an issue in screen 1
4. log out of jira in screen 2
5. back in screen one choose "attach screenshot"

The screen shot applet will open.
fields.summary: Screenshot applet is still accessible from view issue after session timeout.
Extend email handler to stripquotes on <blockquote>
Enlarge the time tracking to.....future
Services doc needs more background on how to create a custom service
Group names aren't allowed to have commas, interface doesn't warn about this
Show Isssue Statistics Details in the caption of "Issue Statistics" gadget
LabelsHeatmapProjectTabPanel.showPanel() performance can be improved
Misleading Error Message in case of wrongly configured wf function plugin: com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException: java.lang.NullPointerException
Not able to render html format of email subject for Activity Stream RSS feed in Outlook

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21830].
  {panel}

I would like to be able to disable irrelevant gadgets that have no functional purpose in and installation and will only confuse users.

Examples would be the  
* Fisheye gadgets for sites that don't use Fisheye
* Bugzilla gadget for sites that weren't imported from Bugzilla
* Votes gadget for sites that don't do voting
* etc.

Creating a Do Not Show list should be relatively easy.

The alternative, removing underlying code components appears to be more problematic due to intertwining, hard coded links, etc.  This may be a longer term design goal.  Support ref [JSP-61501]
fields.summary: Ability to hide unwanted gadgets
Add a way to find filters you are subscribed to

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21826].
  {panel}

Hello,
it would be nice to have the following feature. 

I would like to create the following two filters: 

-Issues created during the last calendar week
-Issues created during this calendar week 

Where "last calendar week" is monday to sunday of the past week it doesn't matter if I'm on day 1 or 2 of the current week. 

Today if I use the filter "created in the last week" it means created in the last 7 days that is not at all the same thing.  because each day of the actual week I get different figures.

I think it is quite a common need to have visibility on the last monday to sunday week and the actual monday to sunday week.
fields.summary: add "actual calendar week" and "last calendar week" filtering options

fields.description: There is too much wasted white space between type divisions in the Issue Links section and yet it is still hard to tell where the divisions are.  Dividers and indentations with connecting dotted lines (a la, JIRA 4.0) should be used instead of whitespace to create an effect as readable or more-so than JIRA 4.0.
fields.summary: Type divisions in the Issue Links section should be more clear and more compact

fields.description: In order to improve readabily of the summaries of linked issues, please reduce their font size in the Issue Links section so that more can fit on a single line.
fields.summary: Reduce the font size of the summaries rendered in the Issue Links section

fields.description:
Please truncate the summaries rendered in the Issue Links section of the Issue View as was done in pre-4.1 JIRA.  Having mulitple wrapping lines makes the Issue Links section extremely hard to parse.

As an improvement over JIRA 4.0, hovering over the truncated summary should bring up a tooltip that displays the full summary.
fields.summary: Summaries should be truncated to column width and have a tooltip
Make post-JIRA 4.1 Issue Links section of issue view as readable as pre-4.1
Adding a comment to issue times out when I have it open in my browser

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

https://support.atlassian.com/secure/GetPage.jspa
https://support.atlassian.com/secure/FullScreen.jspa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21792].
  {panel}

Added these to the EAP CBOX-2 Issue. Copying here for feedback.

A mockup of some colorizing which would go a long way towards helping the eye track around the screen. I did this in a photo editor by changing the Hue on a selection box of the areas. 

The same colorizing applied to the Comment section. 

What if we moved PDT to be with the rest of the info instead of having it's own column by itself? No more wasted space on the right. 

Even on the Project Summary screen. Compare the readability of this mock compared the current.
fields.summary: EAP Colorize Mocks up of Screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21791].
  {panel}

(feedback about http://feedback.onjira.com/browse/BOX-1)

Hi,

On JIRA 4.2 EAP the different boxes : description, attachments, subtasks and links still wastes a lot of space. 

Reducing the font-size won't be enough, for example on BOX-1 :

!fontsize.PNG!

There is still a lot of wasted space.

It is also possible to reduce line spacing 
- over and below thumbnails 
- between each line of subtask

But maybe it could be interesting in this case to have an even/odd colors for each subtask to keep a visual separation ?

For example on this image :

- reduced font size 
- reduced line spacing
- add odd/even color

!oddeven.PNG!


However, it would be interesting to reuse the space lost on the right of the screen for the following boxes :

- description
- attachments 
- subtasks  
- links 
- comments


There is a large white strip on the right because of the 2 columns layout. 
I understand the 2 columns layout is usefull for fields but the biggest parts on the issue are the sections above and it should use the whole width of the screen.
fields.summary: Increase size in width but reduce font size for view issue page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

(feedback for jira instance 4.2 EAP)

Hi,

It could be interresting if there is some visual hints showing a text is collapsed as on the following picture :

!collapsed.PNG!

Otherwise it could be confusing sometimes as the user could forget he reduced the text if he has several fields.
fields.summary: Add a visual indicator when a text is collapsed
Locate field values at a closer and fixed distance from the end of field lables
Remove leading and trailing spaces from Version and Component names
The ability to change gzip settings should require sysadmin (rather than admin) privileges
Add wiki renderer option to Component description field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21757].
  {panel}

Hi,

Currently when you compare dates using the JQL the only supported format is the american date format.
For example: project = OTU AND issuetype in (Incidències, Peticions, Consultes) and  tri<trf
TRI & TRF = Date Time

I think it would be very positive for the product Jira if you added the possibility of comparing dates with european date format.

Regards

Jesús
fields.summary: Compare dates JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21755].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# View a bunch of issues from all different projects so that they are in your history
# Select an issue from a project which is not a sub task and choose the action "Convert to Sub Task"
# Instead of typing in the text field to use the AJAX issue picker, click the "select issue" link to the right
# A popup opens; observe the issues presented in your "history"

The history contains issues which are from other projects, as well as issues which are themselves sub tasks, and even the currently selected issue. None of these issues could possibly be a parent for the chosen issue. The list of issues from the current search correctly filters out these issues, but the "history" list does not.

The user shouldn't have the option to select something which will result in a validation error upon submitting.
fields.summary: Issue Picker popup for Convert to Sub Task should only show issues which are eligible to be parents of the chosen issue
Participants only shows one user when there are clearly more
Project Roles for User view needs role detail in tooltip
Custom Fields API needs to be extended to allow Custom Field Types to dictate whether or not they "need moving"
'Comment hover-over' prevents screen reading applications used by visually impaired from identifying available operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21714].
  {panel}

I don't know if it's just me. I get exited when I hear Mike Cannon-Brookes speak about doing things for all us customers, and granted, I am a satisfied customer. However, when I see what's on the roadmap, I see a lot of new features, but not a lot of attention to issues that are already in the support site for a long time, and they just don't seem to get any love anymore from Jira product management.
I have heard that you seem to be driven by Votes, but even that is not a good approach for reviewing the long open issues, some of which add functionality we all need, but now need to hack the system for to get working. If we can hack the system to make it work, how difficult would it be for some "catch-up developers" to add some of the long open feature/improvement requests we've already submitted?
I want to plead for an effort in Atlassian when the great new things have their roadmap, but where there is also a catch-up development team who will add features we've submitted and which haven't had much love lately (like sometimes years!).
Jira Product Management, what say you?
fields.summary: Review long open issues with feature requests
Support filters/searching of issues containing links of specific types.
Add membersOfProjectRole function to JQL
Add user preference to display new comment instead of issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21703].
  {panel}

The word "Translate," in this case, means translate the statuses from one language to another, but that's unclear from the context, and especially unclear to first-time users, who are still trying to figure out what statuses and steps are. Furthermore, I would guess that this feature isn't used by very many users. These point toward clarifying the wording on this link.

We could do two things, I think:
1) Change "Translate statuses" to "Translate statuses to a different language"
2) Move the link to a less prominent part of the UI, and perhaps attach some country flags to the link so people understand it's referring to languages.
fields.summary: Move "Translate statuses" to less prominent area of the user interface

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21696].
  {panel}

When a user has no issues and no projects in JIRA, they are probably a new user who is unsure about how to use the product, especially for users who are evaluating the product. The "No issues found" screen is fairly important and a chance for us to explain JIRA's functionality in more detail. Currently these screens are fairly empty. I've attached screenshots of some of the important screens.

This could be a very simple fix. For example, the screen that says 

"You have no favourite filters at the moment" 

could be rewritten to say 

"You have no favourite filters. [Learn more about filters|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Saving+Searches+('Issue+Filters')] or [create a new filter]." 

We provide the user with an opportunity to learn more about the product and use the product in a beneficial way, and introduce him/her to the documentation. Furthermore, the cost to existing users is extremely low, as the screens disappear as soon as they begin creating projects.
fields.summary: Improve text on blank screens - "No issues found," "No projects found," etc.
Officially Support Clustered Database for JIRA
How to join projects?
After editing/updating sub-tasks using the action drop down on the issue list (while on the parent task) the page no longer focuses the issue list

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

The Participants custom field,that is part of the JIRA Toolkit, can be selected when add a Notification using _User Custom Field Value_ option, but cannot be added to the Security Level in Security Issue Scheme.
I think this Custom Field and others that could be used in Notification must be able to be used in Security Level.

Regards,
Cesar Gabbardo
fields.summary: Custom Field does not appear to be selected in Security Level setup.

fields.description:
I have been noticing lately that when I open a ticket that is classified as a level 2 and edit the issue the customer has actually set it as priority 4. I would have reported this sooner but was waiting until I came across an example ticket again:

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-60497
fields.summary: SAC or JIRA  Changing Priorities of Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21680].
  {panel}

Currently [Supported Platforms|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Supported+Platforms] doesn't list of any vendors of JDK that we support/test our application with.

Based on our bad experience with the IBM's JDK [JRA-19379|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-19379] we should test OpenJDK and update our documentation accordingly.

OpenJDK becomes more popular due to its availability in linux editions. It would be worth giving some guidelines to our customers to help them avoid possible disappointments.  

FYI. Confluence according to the [Supported Platforms page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] supports only Sun JDK.
fields.summary: Test compatibility between JIRA and OpenJDK

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21679].
  {panel}

Instead of being completely controlled by Global Permissions, the sharing of filters and dashboards could be controlled by a combination of permissions.  This approach would provide some level of filter/dash sharing privileges to all users:

* Share with project (ALL) - restricted to project admins (or controlled by new permission in the permission schemes) (anyone with global permission also can share at this level)
* Share with project (by role) AND Share with group - user allowed to only share with roles to which they belong (implicit permission - no special permission, but add system parameter to turn feature on/off) (anyone with global permission also can share at this level)
* Share with everyone - restricted to global permission only

This approach would allow administrators of larger implementations to have more granular control over how users share filters without restricting users to not be able to collaborate.  All the while, the current behavior can still be achieved by using the global permission.  Whereas, today, it's an all-or-none approach.

This item dovetails with JRA-9997 and JRA-19780.
fields.summary: Security Flexibility for Filter & Dashboard Sharing
Bug in ParametersUtils

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21671].
  {panel}

JIRA cannot currently be deployed in a hosted Tomcat environment :
# It implies the declaration of a JNDI resource for database access
# It implies a modification to the default Tomcat security policy
# It implies the modification of shared server libs

While the first two points can be understandable, the third one is a showstopper - as in a hosted environment, such modifications can affect other web applications deployed on the same server instance.

NOTE : This request as originally a JIRA support request [JSP-57058|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-57058]
fields.summary: Make JIRA deployable in a hosted environment
Make the "Web Resources Plugin" either system or bundled
Heirarchical User Stories/Issues
Screenshot viewer functionality should include the ability to resize
Labels dialog causes javascript error in firefox
"Move to the First Position" & "Move to the Last Position" icons for sub-tasks same as for favorite dashboards
use the {include} macro for the first few instructions on all Admin pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21644].
  {panel}

Recently got the 4.1.x 'new look' 'view issue' and 'edit issue' screens via JIRA Studio. I see much prior discussion, but no prior issue focused on one specific aspect: the fixed-at-top issue title and operations bar. On screens with more spare width than height -- and many laptop widescreens fall into this category -- this behavior severely cramps the interesting discussion log. 

In particular, the fixed-area can take up more than half the viewport (!), with just a few assumptions (which happen to apply on my 13" MacBook, and probably others' laptops as well). Fonts may be generously sized for the small screen -- making a long issue title wrap to 3-4 lines, and the operations tabs wrap to 2 lines  -- and other toolbars/menubars/docks/tab-bars/search-footers further cramp the viewport from top and bottom. This makes very few lines of comment logs visible. 

The old layout used horizontal space more effectively, such that the entire vertical viewport could be used to view the comment-log. 

At least in the current generations of Firefox (3.x) and Safari (5.x), fixating the issue title inside the page is largely redundant, because it already appears in the window title bar. (Further, this info does not need to be repeatedly consulted while browsing an issue's history.) Easy access to operations (especially the most-used 'comment' button) could be provided at top and bottom without impairing the reading of long issue histories. 

I know you don't want to provide an 'old look' toggle; however, simply allowing a toggle (or CSS customization) to disabl the fixed-float of the title/operations-bar would fix 90%+ of this problem on small/wide screens.
fields.summary: allow title/operations-bar to scroll off top -- big benefit for small/wide screens; can be optional
Show filter description as a tips in "Issue Statistics" gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21631].
  {panel}

When in the middle of working on an issue, we use grey in our visual "time" bar for "Remaining" to represent work that is currently logged.
(see screenshot 1)

The problem is that when there is zero work left to do, this breaks down because you ONLY see grey.
This visual is misleading as it can look like there is still work left to do.
(see screenshot 2)
fields.summary: Reconsider the visuals on "Time Tracking" when there is no work left to do.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21630].
  {panel}

Currently the Time Tracking section on View issue show the following order:
* Estimated
* Remaining
* Logged

It would be more sensible if it was:
* Estimated
* Logged
* Remaining

Because this reflects the real-world order of events.
We estimated the work in the past.
We log the work we have done up to now.
And we still have Remaining amount of work to do in the future.
fields.summary: Time Tracking order should be Estimated, Logged, Remaining
Mail Queue management ability
Ability to uncheck comments for Quicksearch - otherwise useless when you have many issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21594].
  {panel}

The group browser admin screen in JIRA does not provide any feedback when a group has been successfully added.

----------------------

This was the sequence of operations performed by one of the Studio devs:

1) Log in and set "Remember Me".
2) Go the Group Browser in JIRA.
3) Wait for a session timeout (or manually invalidate the XSRF token).
4) Add a new group.
5) Click "Retry Operation" on the XSRF error screen.

In this case, the user was not aware that the group had been sucessfully added (because there was no feedback saying so), and attempted to add the group again, this time seeing an error message.

Given that it's not obvious to the user what happens after an XSRF timeout, a simple "You have successfully created group <name>" message would make it clear to the user that the operation did take place.

This is different from most forms in JIRA because the form submits back to itself - it's not clear whether the form has been submitted or not.
fields.summary: No user feedback on successful group creation
DefaultIndexManager doesn't utilize async indexing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21587].
  {panel}

Auto numbering will not work within a table.

|# | first| row|
|# | second| row|

You can auto number outside of the table but that produces more than one table.
# | first| row|
# | second| row|

If you auto number outside of the tables it seems to break the ability to use bullets in the table

| boom | * head
* shot|

# | boom | * head
* shot |
fields.summary: Trouble with numbering and bullets in a table.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21565].
  {panel}

Using colons in ID attributes conflicts with both CSS and JavaScript (particularly jQuery selectors). While there are workarounds involving escaping the colons it is generally considered bad practice.

Notable fields that are using colons are:
* File inputs (eg. attachment:1)
* Date pickers/date range fields (eg. customfield_10000:after)

Fixing these field IDs may break some existing plugins however.
fields.summary: Field IDs incorrectly using colons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21560].
  {panel}

This functionality has been disabled as a part of [JRA-21004|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-21004]. However, we should come up with a new implementation of the support request page in order to allow our customer to provide Support with their data.

There are quite a few customers using the request form to log tickets with us and disabling attachments on it has a negative impact on the quality of provided support (resolution time). Often during triaging we need to go back to customer and ask them to provide data that could be otherwise provided when they were originally reporting the issue.



I believe we were saying something similar in the past:

bq. NOTE: Not providing log files, environment information and backup may result in slower support service.
fields.summary: Reinstate ability to provide Support with backup and log file while submitting support request
Watched Issues: Option to show only issues without a resolution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21538].
  {panel}

This is a place holder issue to track us sending the translation files to the translators.

Notes:

The i18n-jira.r117702.10-06-2010_14-32.zip contains the main JIRA translations

The i18n-bundled-plugins.r117652.10-06-2010_10-39.zip contains the set of translations for the bundled plugins of JIRA. (It only contains data for the fisheye plugin because it is the only bundled plugin that has added new keys that need to be translated.)

Translators: Please make sure the directory structure of these zip files are maintained so we can know who to put the translated files back into the right places.

The *bundled-plugins* zip files only contain translations for plugins that have changed between JIRA 4.1 and JIRA 4.2.  This is why the  bundled plugins zip file only contains translations for the Fisheye plugin.

*4.1.2 Translations*

- [^i18n-bundled-plugins.r117341.15-06-2010_18-11.4_1_2.zip]
- [^i18n-jira.r117341.15-06-2010_18-11.4_1_2.zip]
fields.summary: JIRA 4.2 Translations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21537].
  {panel}

When the wiki renderer is enabled for a field and certain UTF-8 quotes are entered, Firefox renders them as a black square. When clicking the Preview icon they show correctly, and they're entered correctly into the database upon saving, it's just in the text field they're rendered incorrectly. See attached screenshot.

The Unicode characters that don't render correctly are as follows:

||Character||Name||Unicode||
|"|LEFT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK|201C|
|"|RIGHT DOUBLE QUOTATION MARK|201D|
|‚|SINGLE LOW-9 QUOTATION MARK|201A|
|„|DOUBLE LOW-9 QUOTATION MARK|201E|
fields.summary: Firefox renders some UTF-8 quotes as black squares when the wiki renderer enabled
Unable to change the hostname for a mailserver account without also setting the password

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21518].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. open the Task Board
2. click on Log Work or Original Estimate for a task
3. enter a fractional amount (e.g., 1.5) with no unit
4. click the check mark or Log Work button
5. enter the same fractional amount with the default work unit (e.g., h)
6. click the check mark or Log Work button

Observed:
Even with a default work unit set, when you try to enter a fractional amount without a unit, you get an error message saying "Invalid duration, expected format: 2w 3d 4h 30m". If you add the default unit, you do not get the error message. 

Expected:
The default work unit should be used for fractional entries as well as whole numbers.
fields.summary: Unit is required when entering fractional work units

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21506].
  {panel}

Users who integrate JIRA with a MS SQL database with the case sensitive collation won't be able to perform upgrade of the application.

There are a few upgrades task that are failing due to the case sensitive collation.

{noformat}
2010-06-07 12:54:50,487 http-8081-1 ERROR anonymous 774x61x1 9l6cw1 127.0.1.1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Exception thrown during upgrade: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE jiraschema.jiraissue SET  RESOLUTIONDATE = ?  WHERE  id = ?  (Invalid column name 'id'.)
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE jiraschema.jiraissue SET  RESOLUTIONDATE = ?  WHERE  id = ?  (Invalid column name 'id'.)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByPrimaryKey(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:565)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build401.calculateResolutionDateForAllIssues(UpgradeTask_Build401.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build401.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build401.java:116)
{noformat}

or

{noformat}
Exception thrown during upgrade: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE jiraschema.portalpage 
SET ppversion = ? WHERE id = ? (Invalid column name 'id'.) com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: 
SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE jiraschema.portalpage SET ppversion = ? WHERE id = ? (Invalid column name 'id'.)
at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.bulkUpdateByPrimaryKey(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:552) 
at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.tasks.UpgradeTask_Build437.doUpgrade(UpgradeTask_Build437.java:63) 
at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeTaskSucess(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:508) 
{noformat}

Users experiencing similar problems are recommended to create a new database with a case insensitive collation such as _SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI_
fields.summary: JIRA upgrade process is not fully compatible with case sensitive collation

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

JQL expression "filter" should inherit the column order
Two-dimensional gadget does not distinguish different status types
Add the ability to JQL Functions ProjectsWhereUserHasRole and ProjectsWhereUserHasPermission to take a user parameter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21470].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 3 October 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Jira.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the Jira cloud development roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the Jira Cloud roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Answers-Developer-Questions/How-does-the-JIRA-team-use-jira-atlassian-com/qaq-p/475688].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
{panel}

Currently it's not possible to perform a bulk operation on a bunch of sub-tasks to move them to a new parent. This is rather annoying when splitting subtasks off from one task to another (e.g. from a "miscellaneous" task to a specific task once a set of sub-tasks gets large).

It would be great to be able to change the parents of any sub-tasks in a group when a move operation is specified. This seems to make sense anyways and would also allow moving subtasks (along with regular tasks!) to a new project if the new parent task was in the new project.
fields.summary: Bulk move on sub-tasks should support changing the parents
MemoryPropertySet should be replaced because contains major bottleneck for highly loaded systems

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21452].
  {panel}

Cloned from Conflunce. JIRA should do this for all current monospaced textareas (like description, env, comment)


Currently our CSS specifies just 'monospace', which uses the browser's default monospace font. This usually isn't the nicest-looking monospace font available on the platform.

We should add some styles which use the monospace fonts used by the OS on each platform:

- On Windows, Consolas
- On Mac OS X, Monaco.

(Any recommendations on an appropriate Linux monospace font would be great! :))

The font size needs to be specified in px (rather than the current points) because in my testing these fonts appear to vary considerably in size when the same point size is specified. Pixels don't have the same problem.
fields.summary: Better monospace font for monospaced textarea
